item.title: Cloud Services (classic) deployment model is retiring on 31 August 2024
item.description: Cloud Services (classic) retiring in August 2024.
item.atom:content: Cloud Services (classic) retiring in August 2024.

item.title: General Availability: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks is now available in more regions.
item.description: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks is now available in Canada East, West Europe, South Central US and West US 3.
item.atom:content: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks is now available in Canada East, West Europe, South Central US and West US 3.

item.title: Public preview: Internet inbound for Network Virtual Appliances in Virtual WAN Hubs
item.description: Public preview for internet inbound (Destination NAT) capabilities for Next-Generation Firewall Network Virtual Appliances deployed in the Virtual WAN hub. Destination NAT allows network administrators to publish applications to the broader internet through a public IP address assigned to a Firewall Network Virtual Appliance deployed in a Virtual WAN hub.
item.atom:content: Public preview for internet inbound (Destination NAT) capabilities for Next-Generation Firewall Network Virtual Appliances deployed in the Virtual WAN hub. Destination NAT allows network administrators to publish applications to the broader internet through a public IP address assigned to a Firewall Network Virtual Appliance deployed in a Virtual WAN hub.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Functions Support for HTTP Streams in Node.js
item.description: Use this feature for use cases where real time exchange and interaction between client and server over HTTP connections is needed.
item.atom:content: Use this feature for use cases where real time exchange and interaction between client and server over HTTP connections is needed.

item.title: Public preview: Kubernetes 1.29 support in AKS
item.description: You can now try out Kubernetes 1.29 preview version with AKS and get ready for Kubernetes 1.29 GA in your production environment.
item.atom:content: You can now try out Kubernetes 1.29 preview version with AKS and get ready for Kubernetes 1.29 GA in your production environment.

item.title: Public preview: OS SKU in-place migration for Linux nodes
item.description: You can now migrate nodes from one Linux OS to another without having to create new nodes.
item.atom:content: You can now migrate nodes from one Linux OS to another without having to create new nodes.

item.title: Generally Available: Node Soak Duration for Upgrades
item.description: You can set a low soak time value during a node upgrade to wait between draining a node and proceeding to reimage it.
item.atom:content: You can set a low soak time value during a node upgrade to wait between draining a node and proceeding to reimage it.

item.title: Generally Available: Capacity Reservations support in AKS
item.description: You can now better manage your changing workload demands by using capacity reservation groups.
item.atom:content: You can now better manage your changing workload demands by using capacity reservation groups.

item.title: GA: Istio-based service mesh add-on for Azure Kubernetes Service
item.description: You can deploy an officially supported Istio addon for AKS
item.atom:content: You can deploy an officially supported Istio addon for AKS

item.title: Public preview: Disable network policy in AKS for migration
item.description: You can now temporarily disable your network policy engines to perform a migration.
item.atom:content: You can now temporarily disable your network policy engines to perform a migration.

item.title: Public preview: AKS support for node soak duration for upgrades
item.description: You can now stagger AKS node upgrades and minimize application downtime.
item.atom:content: You can now stagger AKS node upgrades and minimize application downtime.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for late-February 2024
item.description: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-February 2024.
item.atom:content: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-February 2024.

item.title: General availability: Latest PostgreSQL minor versions supported by Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 16.1, 15.5, 14.10, 13.13, 12.17, 11.22
item.atom:content: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 16.1, 15.5, 14.10, 13.13, 12.17, 11.22

item.title: General availability: Azure SDKs support for Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: Now you can use Azure SDKs including .NET SDK, Go SDK, Java SDK, JavaScript SDK, and Python SDK to manage the lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters.
item.atom:content: Now you can use Azure SDKs including .NET SDK, Go SDK, Java SDK, JavaScript SDK, and Python SDK to manage the lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters.

item.title: General availability: Azure CLI support for Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: You can now use Azure CLI to manage the whole lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters from provisioning to scaling to configuration changes and starting/stopping cluster compute.
item.atom:content: You can now use Azure CLI to manage the whole lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters from provisioning to scaling to configuration changes and starting/stopping cluster compute.

item.title: General availability: Application Gateway for Containers
item.description: Application Gateway for Containers is the next evolution to Application Gateway's Ingress Controller; bringing performance, scale, deployment, and feature enhancements.
item.atom:content: Application Gateway for Containers is the next evolution to Application Gateway's Ingress Controller; bringing performance, scale, deployment, and feature enhancements.

item.title: Enable replication for added VMware VM data disks
item.description: Azure Site Recovery now supports enabling replication for data disks that you add to a VMware VM that's already enabled for disaster recovery.
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery now supports enabling replication for data disks that you add to a VMware VM that's already enabled for disaster recovery.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Application Gateway introduces support for TLS and TCP protocols
item.description: TLS and TCP protocol support now available through Azure Application Gateway.
item.atom:content: TLS and TCP protocol support now available through Azure Application Gateway.

item.title: Announcing NBCROW Compression in Kusto's TDS Implementation
item.description: A new feature that reduces the data transfer for MSSQL queries on Kusto.
item.atom:content: A new feature that reduces the data transfer for MSSQL queries on Kusto.

item.title: Sending a log search alert with cross tenant target resource will no longer be supported
item.description: As of March 15, 2024, this behavior will change and sending a log search alert with a cross tenant target resource (except for the lighthouse case) will no longer be supported. Alerts will not be sent to unauthorized target resources, and log search alert rules with an unauthorized target will be ignored. This will ensure that only authorized users can receive and investigate log search alerts.
item.atom:content: As of March 15, 2024, this behavior will change and sending a log search alert with a cross tenant target resource (except for the lighthouse case) will no longer be supported. Alerts will not be sent to unauthorized target resources, and log search alert rules with an unauthorized target will be ignored. This will ensure that only authorized users can receive and investigate log search alerts.

item.title: Update records in a Kusto Database (public preview)
item.description: The new .update command allows you to update records (rows) in a Kusto Database (either in Azure Data Explorer or in Fabric KQL Database). This is a new tool to help you build great data pipeline!
item.atom:content: The new .update command allows you to update records (rows) in a Kusto Database (either in Azure Data Explorer or in Fabric KQL Database). This is a new tool to help you build great data pipeline!

item.title: Public Preview: Regional Disaster Recovery by Azure Backup for AKS
item.description: Customers can now utilize Azure Backup for AKS to recover their containerized applications and data during a regional disaster scenario.
item.atom:content: Customers can now utilize Azure Backup for AKS to recover their containerized applications and data during a regional disaster scenario.

item.title: General Availability: Azure NetApp Files Standard Network Features - Edit Volumes
item.description: Azure NetApp Files Standard Network Features - Edit Volumes GA
item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files Standard Network Features - Edit Volumes GA

item.title: Public preview: Configuration-as-code customizations in Microsoft Dev Box
item.description: Customization enables developers to efficiently configure workstations to their exact project requirements, within guardrails set by admins that enforce governance and security policies.
item.atom:content: Customization enables developers to efficiently configure workstations to their exact project requirements, within guardrails set by admins that enforce governance and security policies.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Storage Actions — Serverless storage data management
item.description: Azure Storage Actions is a fully managed platform that helps you automate data management tasks for Azure Blob Storage and Azure Data Lake Storage.
item.atom:content: Azure Storage Actions is a fully managed platform that helps you automate data management tasks for Azure Blob Storage and Azure Data Lake Storage.

item.title: Generally available: Support for Azure VMs using Ultra disks in Azure Backup
item.description: General availability for the support for Azure VMs using Ultra disks in Azure Backup.
item.atom:content: General availability for the support for Azure VMs using Ultra disks in Azure Backup.

item.title: Generally available: Support for Azure VMs using Premium SSD v2 in Azure Backup
item.description: General availability for the support for Azure VMs using Premium SSD v2 in Azure Backup.
item.atom:content: General availability for the support for Azure VMs using Premium SSD v2 in Azure Backup.

item.title: Execute Azure Monitor Logs connector on exact time range provided dynamically (preview)
item.description: Azure Monitor Logs connector lets you query data in your Log Analytics workspace or Application Insights components per Logic App trigger or schedule, and list or visualize results. The Time range…
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor Logs connector lets you query data in your Log Analytics workspace or Application Insights components per Logic App trigger or schedule, and list or visualize results. The Time range…

item.title: General Availability: Trusted launch for Azure VMs in China regions
item.description: Azure China cloud regions now support Trusted Launch Virtual Machines to improve security posture of an Azure Virtual Machine.
item.atom:content: Azure China cloud regions now support Trusted Launch Virtual Machines to improve security posture of an Azure Virtual Machine.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier support on Change Feed and Object Replication
item.description: Azure Blob Change Feed and Object Replication now support Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier.
item.atom:content: Azure Blob Change Feed and Object Replication now support Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier.

item.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for mid-February 2024
item.description: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-February 2024.
item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-February 2024.

item.title: General availability: Customer managed key encryption for Enterprise tier caches
item.description: Encrypt Redis persistence files using customer managed keys.
item.atom:content: Encrypt Redis persistence files using customer managed keys.

item.title: Public preview: Migration service in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description: Easily migrate PostgreSQL to Azure with a managed service supporting full schema and data migrations, without complexity.
item.atom:content: Easily migrate PostgreSQL to Azure with a managed service supporting full schema and data migrations, without complexity.

item.title: Public preview: Azure SQL migration assessment enabled by Azure Arc
item.description: With SQL Server enabled by Azure Arc you can now begin your migration journey from directly within the Azure Arc environment with recommended Azure SQL deployment option that best fits your workload needs.
item.atom:content: With SQL Server enabled by Azure Arc you can now begin your migration journey from directly within the Azure Arc environment with recommended Azure SQL deployment option that best fits your workload needs.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Flow Trace Logs and Autoscaling based on number of connections are now generally available
item.description: Flow Trace Logs provide more visibility into the TCP handshake, providing insight into whether traffic is properly flowing through the firewall. In addition, Azure Firewall can now autoscale based on number of connections, providing more scaling adaptability to dynamic workloads.
item.atom:content: Flow Trace Logs provide more visibility into the TCP handshake, providing insight into whether traffic is properly flowing through the firewall. In addition, Azure Firewall can now autoscale based on number of connections, providing more scaling adaptability to dynamic workloads.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Parallel IP Group update support is now in public preview
item.description: Parallel IP Group support enables administrators to simultaneously update multiple IP Groups in a firewall, streamlining the process of implementing devOps changes.
item.atom:content: Parallel IP Group support enables administrators to simultaneously update multiple IP Groups in a firewall, streamlining the process of implementing devOps changes.

item.title: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available
item.description: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available, the industry’s first fully managed and cloud-native SAN offering that simplifies deploying, scaling, managing, and configuring a SAN in the cloud.
item.atom:content: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available, the industry’s first fully managed and cloud-native SAN offering that simplifies deploying, scaling, managing, and configuring a SAN in the cloud.

item.title: Public preview: AKS cluster control plane metrics in managed Prometheus
item.description: You can now monitor the health, load and performance of the API server and etcd in the control plane of your AKS clusters
item.atom:content: You can now monitor the health, load and performance of the API server and etcd in the control plane of your AKS clusters

item.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in Canada Central
item.description: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in the Canada Central region.
item.atom:content: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in the Canada Central region.

item.title: General availability: Improvements in Azure Key Vault
item.description: Improvements in Azure Key Vault: FIPS 140-2 Level 3, PCI DSS and PCI 3DS certified for all customers.
item.atom:content: Improvements in Azure Key Vault: FIPS 140-2 Level 3, PCI DSS and PCI 3DS certified for all customers.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files Standard Network Features - Edit Volumes in US Gov Regions
item.description: Azure NetApp Files in US Gov region now supports ability to edit existing ANF volumes and upgrading Basic network features to Standard network features.
item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files in US Gov region now supports ability to edit existing ANF volumes and upgrading Basic network features to Standard network features.

item.title: Generally available: Support for up to 100 TB of storage for the FHIR service
item.description: The FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services supports up to 100 TB of storage. The FHIR service can store and exchange large amounts of health data, and each FHIR service instance has a 4 TB storage limit by default. However, if you have more data, you can ask Microsoft to increase storage up to 100 TB for your FHIR service.
item.atom:content: The FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services supports up to 100 TB of storage. The FHIR service can store and exchange large amounts of health data, and each FHIR service instance has a 4 TB storage limit by default. However, if you have more data, you can ask Microsoft to increase storage up to 100 TB for your FHIR service.

item.title: Azure Ultra Disk Storage is now available in Canada East
item.description: Now available in Canada East region, Azure Ultra Disk Storage provides high performance along with sub-millisecond latency for your most-demanding workloads.
item.atom:content: Now available in Canada East region, Azure Ultra Disk Storage provides high performance along with sub-millisecond latency for your most-demanding workloads.

item.title: Mount Azure Storage as a local share in App Service Linux Now supports NFS
item.description: NFS support is now available for App Service Linux code and container when mounting a Azure File share as a local share for the web app.
item.atom:content: NFS support is now available for App Service Linux code and container when mounting a Azure File share as a local share for the web app.

item.title: Announcing General Availability to migrate Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer Cluster to Private Endpoints
item.description: The migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints in generally available now. The process is simple and can be done using the Azure portal, the ARM template, or any code which uses the ADX SDK.
item.atom:content: The migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints in generally available now. The process is simple and can be done using the Azure portal, the ARM template, or any code which uses the ADX SDK.

item.title: Support for log alert rules that use cross-workspace queries with resource names or qualified name identifiers will be retired on 31 May 2024
item.description: As of May 31, 2024, log alert rules will no longer support cross-workspace queries that use resource names or qualified name identifiers.
item.atom:content: As of May 31, 2024, log alert rules will no longer support cross-workspace queries that use resource names or qualified name identifiers.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager security admin rule generally available in 30 regions
item.description: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 30 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 30 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager topology view now generally available
item.description: Visualize Azure Virtual Network Manager connectivity configurations with topology view.
item.atom:content: Visualize Azure Virtual Network Manager connectivity configurations with topology view.

item.title: Private Preview: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs (Windows OS)
item.description: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Stack HCI latest feature release
item.description: Azure Stack HCI is the Microsoft Azure Arc-enabled infrastructure. Now, customers who have an Azure Stack HCI subscription can download the latest feature release for their infrastructure. This new Azure Stack HCI release is the version of the product required to run Azure Virtual Desktop on- prem which is also now in GA and called Azure Virtual Desktop for Azure Stack HCI. This is an exciting development as the public preview of this product is in high demand specifically in Healthcare and Financial Services.
item.atom:content: Azure Stack HCI is the Microsoft Azure Arc-enabled infrastructure. Now, customers who have an Azure Stack HCI subscription can download the latest feature release for their infrastructure. This new Azure Stack HCI release is the version of the product required to run Azure Virtual Desktop on- prem which is also now in GA and called Azure Virtual Desktop for Azure Stack HCI. This is an exciting development as the public preview of this product is in high demand specifically in Healthcare and Financial Services.

item.title: Generally Available: Continuous model monitoring in Azure Machine Learning
item.description: Azure Machine Learning model monitoring is now generally available.
item.atom:content: Azure Machine Learning model monitoring is now generally available.

item.title: Announcing General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API
item.description: General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data plane API We are excited to share Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API is Now Generally Available! Unlock enhanced insights into the monitoring of your Azure resources with our powerful API. Explore its features and elevate your monitoring experience today!
item.atom:content: General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data plane API We are excited to share Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API is Now Generally Available! Unlock enhanced insights into the monitoring of your Azure resources with our powerful API. Explore its features and elevate your monitoring experience today!

item.title: Public Preview: Azure API Center – January Updates
item.description: Azure API Center is your one-stop solution for inventorying and managing your organization’s APIs. In this update, we are bringing you new features and improvements to help you discover, reuse, and consume your APIs more easily and efficiently. These features are designed to help you streamline your API lifecycle, improve your developer experience, and increase your API adoption.
item.atom:content: Azure API Center is your one-stop solution for inventorying and managing your organization’s APIs. In this update, we are bringing you new features and improvements to help you discover, reuse, and consume your APIs more easily and efficiently. These features are designed to help you streamline your API lifecycle, improve your developer experience, and increase your API adoption.

item.title: Public preview: Istio add-on for AKS now supports plug-in certificate authority (CA)
item.description: You can now bring your own certificates and keys to use with Istio add-on for signing workload certificates for improved security.
item.atom:content: You can now bring your own certificates and keys to use with Istio add-on for signing workload certificates for improved security.

item.title: Generally Available: Support for Cross Region Restore for PostgreSQL backups
item.description: Cross region for Backup vault using Azure Backup is now generally available.
item.atom:content: Cross region for Backup vault using Azure Backup is now generally available.

item.title: Public preview: Upgrade support in Istio add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now upgrade to new Istio revisions as they are made available in the Istio add-on for AKS.
item.atom:content: You can now upgrade to new Istio revisions as they are made available in the Istio add-on for AKS.

item.title: Public Preview: New major version of durable Functions extension
item.description: Durable Functions extension v3.0.0 is currently in public preview. This new major version introduces major changes that benefit those using Azure Storage backend.
item.atom:content: Durable Functions extension v3.0.0 is currently in public preview. This new major version introduces major changes that benefit those using Azure Storage backend.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Functions Support for Java 21 on Linux
item.description: Azure Functions now supports Java 21 in preview on dedicated, consumption, and premium plans for Linux.
item.atom:content: Azure Functions now supports Java 21 in preview on dedicated, consumption, and premium plans for Linux.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Container Apps supports additional TCP ports
item.description: You can now run containers apps that accept TCP connections on multiple ports.
item.atom:content: You can now run containers apps that accept TCP connections on multiple ports.

item.title: Public Preview: Distributed tracing v2 for durable Functions
item.description: Distributed tracing v2 for durable Functions is in public preview. This version supports all languages and storage backends and provides detailed spans.
item.atom:content: Distributed tracing v2 for durable Functions is in public preview. This version supports all languages and storage backends and provides detailed spans.

item.title: Visual Studio Code extension update for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
item.description: You can use VS Code extension update for AKS to interact with a new create cluster experience, abort/reconcile cluster, and more.
item.atom:content: You can use VS Code extension update for AKS to interact with a new create cluster experience, abort/reconcile cluster, and more.

item.title: Public preview: Node OS API options feature for AKS
item.description: You can now get Node IP for tasks such as troubleshooting, without needing kubectl access
item.atom:content: You can now get Node IP for tasks such as troubleshooting, without needing kubectl access

item.title: Public preview: Disable Secure Shell (SSH) support in AKS
item.description: You can now disable SSH for AKS to reduce the attach surface on your cluster.
item.atom:content: You can now disable SSH for AKS to reduce the attach surface on your cluster.

item.title: Generally Available: Outbound type migration in AKS
item.description: You can now update the outbound type of existing clusters without having to rebuild the cluster
item.atom:content: You can now update the outbound type of existing clusters without having to rebuild the cluster

item.title: Public preview: Kube-reserved resource optimization in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
item.description: You will see AKS reserve up to 20% less memorry on nodes.
item.atom:content: You will see AKS reserve up to 20% less memorry on nodes.

item.title: General availability: PgAudit in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: Database session and object audit logging of database activities in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL.
item.atom:content: Database session and object audit logging of database activities in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL.

item.title: General Availability: Read replica in special regions with Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Read replica now available in Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet and Azure Government regions.
item.atom:content: Read replica now available in Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet and Azure Government regions.

item.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for late-January 2024

item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-January 2024.

item.title: General Availability: Server logs for Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Enhance your database monitoring with the new server log feature for Azure Database for PostgreSQL, offering customizable retention and straightforward downloading for operational excellence.
item.atom:content: Enhance your database monitoring with the new server log feature for Azure Database for PostgreSQL, offering customizable retention and straightforward downloading for operational excellence.

item.atom:content: Customer-managed keys allow you to use your own key for cluster data encryption at rest.

item.title: General availability: Israel Central region added to Azure HDInsight
General availability: Italy North region added to Azure HDInsight
Public preview: ExpressRoute guided portal experience for multi-site resiliency
item.description: With multi-site resiliency, you can configure your ExpressRoute circuits through more than a single peering location. This helps ensure that your’ private connection to Microsoft remains available even if one of the locations experiences an outage. The experience is targeted at helping you design a highly resilient ExpressRoute solution to connect their on-premises with Microsoft backbone and Azure Virtual Networks.
item.atom:content: With multi-site resiliency, you can configure your ExpressRoute circuits through more than a single peering location. This helps ensure that your’ private connection to Microsoft remains available even if one of the locations experiences an outage. The experience is targeted at helping you design a highly resilient ExpressRoute solution to connect their on-premises with Microsoft backbone and Azure Virtual Networks.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Business Continuity Center is now available in all regions
item.description: Azure Business Continuity Center is now available in all regions
item.atom:content: Azure Business Continuity Center is now available in all regions

item.title: Improved exports experience
item.description: Introducing an improved exports experience that makes FinOps easier and more efficient with access to additional datasets and optimized for handling large data. You can also create and manage your exports with a few clicks, download your cost data in FOCUS format, and maintain compatibility with previous schema versions, enhance your security and compliance while saving time and money.
item.atom:content: Introducing an improved exports experience that makes FinOps easier and more efficient with access to additional datasets and optimized for handling large data. You can also create and manage your exports with a few clicks, download your cost data in FOCUS format, and maintain compatibility with previous schema versions, enhance your security and compliance while saving time and money.

item.title: Generally available: Up to 50 test fail criteria in Azure Load Testing
item.description: You can now specify up to 50 test criteria in your load test.
item.atom:content: You can now specify up to 50 test criteria in your load test.

item.title: Azure Red Hat OpenShift January 2024 updates
item.description: Azure Red Hat OpenShift now offers Resource Health for clusters with integration with Azure Monitor via Signals and Alerts.
item.atom:content: Azure Red Hat OpenShift now offers Resource Health for clusters with integration with Azure Monitor via Signals and Alerts.

item.title: Preview: Selectable search parameter capability for the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services
item.description: The selectable search parameter capability for the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services allows you to tailor and enhance searches on FHIR resources. You can choose which inbuilt search parameters to enable or disable for the FHIR service according to your unique requirements. By enabling only the search parameters you need, you can store more FHIR resources and potentially improve performance of FHIR search queries.
item.atom:content: The selectable search parameter capability for the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services allows you to tailor and enhance searches on FHIR resources. You can choose which inbuilt search parameters to enable or disable for the FHIR service according to your unique requirements. By enabling only the search parameters you need, you can store more FHIR resources and potentially improve performance of FHIR search queries.

item.title: Cloud Services (classic) deployment model is retiring on 31 August 2024
item.description: Migrate your cloud services to a new deployment model before 31 August 2024.
item.atom:content: Migrate your cloud services to a new deployment model before 31 August 2024.

item.title: Dedicated clusters in Azure Monitor logs now support any commitment tier
item.description: We are pleased to announce that it is now possible to create dedicated clusters in public and sovereign clouds at any commitment tiers, starting at a minimum of 100GB per day. This capability is…
item.atom:content: We are pleased to announce that it is now possible to create dedicated clusters in public and sovereign clouds at any commitment tiers, starting at a minimum of 100GB per day. This capability is…

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Automation Runtime environment & support for Azure CLI commands in runbooks
item.description: Azure Automation introduces Runtime environment (preview) and enables support for Azure CLI commands in runbooks.
item.atom:content: Azure Automation introduces Runtime environment (preview) and enables support for Azure CLI commands in runbooks.

item.title: New Features for graph-match KQL Operator: Enhanced Pattern Matching and Cycle Control
item.description: The graph-match operator in Kusto Query Language (KQL) allows you to query your data as a graph and find matches for a specified pattern. The latest update introduces two new features: the cycles parameter and the nonlinear patterns. These features enable you to control how cycles are matched and express more complex and flexible patterns in your graph queries.
item.atom:content: The graph-match operator in Kusto Query Language (KQL) allows you to query your data as a graph and find matches for a specified pattern. The latest update introduces two new features: the cycles parameter and the nonlinear patterns. These features enable you to control how cycles are matched and express more complex and flexible patterns in your graph queries.

item.title: Automatic Image Creation using Azure VM Image Builder is now generally available
item.description: We’re happy to announce automatic image creation using Azure Image Builder is now generally available. This feature improves your speed and efficiency by allowing you the ability to start image builds for new base images automatically.
item.atom:content: We’re happy to announce automatic image creation using Azure Image Builder is now generally available. This feature improves your speed and efficiency by allowing you the ability to start image builds for new base images automatically.

item.title: General availability: Azure Data Explorer adds new geospatial capabilities
item.description: Kusto now has three new geospatial functions: geo_polygon_to_h3cells(), geo_angle() and geo_azimuth(). These functions are designed to help you better understand and analyze your geospatial data.
item.atom:content: Kusto now has three new geospatial functions: geo_polygon_to_h3cells(), geo_angle() and geo_azimuth(). These functions are designed to help you better understand and analyze your geospatial data.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Monitor VM Insights Dependency Agent support for RHEL 8.6 Linux VMs
item.description: Azure Monitor VM Insights now supports Dependency Agent for RHEL 8.6 Linux VMs, enabling you to monitor their network connections and processes in the Azure portal.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor VM Insights now supports Dependency Agent for RHEL 8.6 Linux VMs, enabling you to monitor their network connections and processes in the Azure portal.

item.title: Generally available: FHIR service integration with Azure Active Directory B2C
item.description: Now you can use the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services with Azure Active Directory B2C (Azure AD B2C). This capability gives healthcare organizations a secure and convenient way to grant access the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services without creating or comingling user accounts in their organization’s Microsoft Entra ID tenant.
item.atom:content: Now you can use the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services with Azure Active Directory B2C (Azure AD B2C). This capability gives healthcare organizations a secure and convenient way to grant access the FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services without creating or comingling user accounts in their organization’s Microsoft Entra ID tenant.

item.title: Azure Advisor integration with Azure Monitor Log Analytics Workspace
item.description:
Advisor is a personalized cloud consultant that helps you follow best practices to optimize your Azure deployments.
It analyzes your resource configuration and usage telemetry and then recommends solutions that can help you improve the cost effectiveness, performance, Reliability, and security of your Azure resources.
We in Azure Monitor believe that observability should be cost effective, and we want to help our customers control their cost, operational excellence, performance, reliability, and security of their Azure resources. This, in turn, helps grow their overall satisfaction with, and usage of Azure.
We have introduced several cost optimization related recommendations and added Azure Advisor to the Log Analytics Workspace admin experience. more recommendations are on the way.
item.atom:content:
Advisor is a personalized cloud consultant that helps you follow best practices to optimize your Azure deployments.
It analyzes your resource configuration and usage telemetry and then recommends solutions that can help you improve the cost effectiveness, performance, Reliability, and security of your Azure resources.
We in Azure Monitor believe that observability should be cost effective, and we want to help our customers control their cost, operational excellence, performance, reliability, and security of their Azure resources. This, in turn, helps grow their overall satisfaction with, and usage of Azure.
We have introduced several cost optimization related recommendations and added Azure Advisor to the Log Analytics Workspace admin experience. more recommendations are on the way.

item.title: Public Preview: Circuit Breaker in Azure API Management
item.description: Customers now have the capability to configure the circuit breaker property in the backend resource, providing protection for a backend service against being overwhelmed by excessive requests.
item.atom:content: Customers now have the capability to configure the circuit breaker property in the backend resource, providing protection for a backend service against being overwhelmed by excessive requests.

item.title: Public Preview: Load Balancer in Azure API Management
item.description: Customers have the ability to create a load balancer that directs traffic to multiple endpoints.
item.atom:content: Customers have the ability to create a load balancer that directs traffic to multiple endpoints.

item.title: Azure Spring Apps Feature Update Q4 2024: Spring Cloud Gateway supports a response cache and more
item.description: Recent updates to the Enterprise plan include improved response caching in Spring Cloud Gateway, a more secure try-out option in API Portal, and enhanced application-level settings in Service Connector. Additionally, there's richer build history information to help with troubleshooting. For both Enterprise and Basic/Standard plans, Azure Spring Apps now offer scheduled maintenance for updates and an auto-sync feature for certificates, making application management more efficient and secure.
item.atom:content: Recent updates to the Enterprise plan include improved response caching in Spring Cloud Gateway, a more secure try-out option in API Portal, and enhanced application-level settings in Service Connector. Additionally, there's richer build history information to help with troubleshooting. For both Enterprise and Basic/Standard plans, Azure Spring Apps now offer scheduled maintenance for updates and an auto-sync feature for certificates, making application management more efficient and secure.

item.title: Public preview: Partition merge now supports shared throughput databases

item.atom:content: You can now merge partitions in Azure Cosmos DB on shared throughput databases. Merging partitions allows you to reduce the number of physical partitions used for your container.

item.title: General availability: Azure Virtual Network encryption
item.description: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.

item.title: General Availability: Customer-managed keys for Azure NetApp Files volume encryption

item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files volumes supports encryption with customer-managed keys (CMK), using Azure Key Vault for key storage, to enable an extra layer of security for data at rest.

item.title: Azure Stream Analytics No-code Editor: new features and improvements in Jan 2024

item.title: Generally Available: Multi-line Logging Feature in Azure Monitor - Container Insights
item.description: Multi-Line Logging in Azure Monitor - Container Insights is designed to simplify and streamline your Log Analysis. This feature allows you to seamlessly collect and store multiple lines of log data within a single log entry, enhancing the ease with which you can view and analyze logs from your containerized applications.

item.title: Generally Available: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.9 now supported on Azure Virtual Machines
item.description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 8.9 is the latest minor release of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8, which provides stability and security for production environments along with bug fixes and enhancements for improved performance and reliability. It also includes more features and capabilities to help customers customize their operating environment while maintaining the consistency needed for more efficient management and deployment across varied infrastructures.
item.atom:content: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 8.9 is the latest minor release of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8, which provides stability and security for production environments along with bug fixes and enhancements for improved performance and reliability. It also includes more features and capabilities to help customers customize their operating environment while maintaining the consistency needed for more efficient management and deployment across varied infrastructures.

item.title: Generally available: Crash Consistent VM Restore points
item.description: For Azure partners and customers seeking to develop business continuity and disaster recovery solutions, crash-consistent VM restore points serve as feature-rich building blocks, offering an agentless solution available natively on the Azure platform.
item.atom:content: For Azure partners and customers seeking to develop business continuity and disaster recovery solutions, crash-consistent VM restore points serve as feature-rich building blocks, offering an agentless solution available natively on the Azure platform.

item.title: Store and manage medical imaging data with Azure Data Lake Storage (Preview)

item.atom:content: With the integration of Azure Data Lake Storage and the DICOM service, organizations can now enjoy full control over their imaging data and increased flexibility for accessing and working with that data through the Azure storage ecosystem and APIs.

item.title: Public preview: Intel TDX based confidential VMs now available in the Azure portal, Azure CLI and ARM templates

item.atom:content: The DCesv5 and ECesv5-series confidential virtual machines (VMs) are now available in the Azure portal and via the CLI and ARM templates. These VMs enable organizations to bring confidential workloads to the cloud without code changes to applications.

item.title: Delaying Domain Front Block on Azure Front Door and CDN services
item.description: Azure Front Door and Azure CDN Standard from Microsoft (classic) are postponing the domain fronting blocking enforcement to January 22, 2024, and will add two log fields to help you check if your resources display domain fronting behavior by December 25, 2023.
item.atom:content: Azure Front Door and Azure CDN Standard from Microsoft (classic) are postponing the domain fronting blocking enforcement to January 22, 2024, and will add two log fields to help you check if your resources display domain fronting behavior by December 25, 2023.

item.title: Migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints
item.description: If you are using VNet injection to secure your Azure Data Explorer (ADX) cluster, you may face some challenges such as complexity, scalability, and public IP dependency. We recommend that you switch to Azure Private Endpoints, which allow you to connect to your cluster privately within your VNet. We have released a preview feature that lets you migrate your VNet injected ADX cluster to Private Endpoints easily and quickly.
item.atom:content: If you are using VNet injection to secure your Azure Data Explorer (ADX) cluster, you may face some challenges such as complexity, scalability, and public IP dependency. We recommend that you switch to Azure Private Endpoints, which allow you to connect to your cluster privately within your VNet. We have released a preview feature that lets you migrate your VNet injected ADX cluster to Private Endpoints easily and quickly.

item.title: Azure support plan offer extended to June 30, 2024
item.description: Beginning January 1, 2024, all new and renewing Azure customers who purchase an Enterprise Agreement (EA or EES) or are part of the field-led Microsoft Customer Agreement (MCA) will receive Azure Standard support. Qualifications for the promotion will end on June 30, 2024.
item.atom:content: Beginning January 1, 2024, all new and renewing Azure customers who purchase an Enterprise Agreement (EA or EES) or are part of the field-led Microsoft Customer Agreement (MCA) will receive Azure Standard support. Qualifications for the promotion will end on June 30, 2024.

item.description: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks
item.atom:content: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks

item.title: Azure Web PubSub support for Socket.IO now generally available
item.description: Use your preferred Socket.IO APIs, while letting Azure handle messages and scaling for you
item.atom:content: Use your preferred Socket.IO APIs, while letting Azure handle messages and scaling for you

item.title: Generally Available: Collect Syslog from AKS nodes using Azure Monitor Container Insights
item.description: The Syslog collection feature in Azure Monitor - Container Insights is generally available.
item.atom:content: The Syslog collection feature in Azure Monitor - Container Insights is generally available.

item.title: Part numbers from EA invoice are now added to the cost and usage file.
item.description: All records in cost and usage file will now match the part numbers in an invoice for EA customers. This will allow leveraging the part number to match invoice and cost details data. Please note that when comparing charges, refunds for purchases done in past billing periods should be excluded.
item.atom:content: All records in cost and usage file will now match the part numbers in an invoice for EA customers. This will allow leveraging the part number to match invoice and cost details data. Please note that when comparing charges, refunds for purchases done in past billing periods should be excluded.

item.title: Part numbers from EA invoice are now added to the cost and usage file.
item.description: All records in cost and usage file will now match the part numbers in an invoice for EA customers. This will allow leveraging the part number to match invoice and cost details data. Please note that when comparing charges, refunds for purchases done in past billing periods should be excluded.
item.atom:content: All records in cost and usage file will now match the part numbers in an invoice for EA customers. This will allow leveraging the part number to match invoice and cost details data. Please note that when comparing charges, refunds for purchases done in past billing periods should be excluded.

item.title: Generally available: Delete Jobs API to support bulk delete in Azure Digital Twins
item.description: GA release for bulk delete support for Azure Digital Twins
item.atom:content: GA release for bulk delete support for Azure Digital Twins

item.category: Azure Health Data Services; FHIR service; DICOM service
item.title: General availability: Encryption with customer-managed keys in Azure Health Data Services
item.description: The ability to encrypt health data in the cloud with customer-managed keys using Azure Health Data Services is generally available.
item.atom:content: The ability to encrypt health data in the cloud with customer-managed keys using Azure Health Data Services is generally available.

item.title: General availability: Reservations for Microsoft Fabric
item.description: You can now save up to 40.5% on Microsoft Fabric capacity when you commit to one-year reservations.
item.atom:content: You can now save up to 40.5% on Microsoft Fabric capacity when you commit to one-year reservations.

item.title: Generally Available: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.3 now supported on Azure Virtual Machines
item.description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 9.3, the latest version of RHEL 9 from Red Hat is now generally available on Azure Virtual Machines (VMs). Availability of RHEL 9.3 for VMs on Azure is a step forward towards offering a more scalable, flexible Linux platform that pairs container innovation with a strong security posture.
item.atom:content: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 9.3, the latest version of RHEL 9 from Red Hat is now generally available on Azure Virtual Machines (VMs). Availability of RHEL 9.3 for VMs on Azure is a step forward towards offering a more scalable, flexible Linux platform that pairs container innovation with a strong security posture.

item.title: General availability: Integration of Azure Monitor Agent support with Connection Monitor
item.description: Integration of Azure Monitor Agent support in Connection Monitor for monitoring connectivity across ARC enabled endpoints as sources and destinations
item.atom:content: Integration of Azure Monitor Agent support in Connection Monitor for monitoring connectivity across ARC enabled endpoints as sources and destinations

item.title: Public preview: Private subnet
item.description: Private subnet is a new feature that allows you to create subnets that prevent the creation of insecure default outbound public IP address creation
item.atom:content: Private subnet is a new feature that allows you to create subnets that prevent the creation of insecure default outbound public IP address creation

item.title: Public Preview: Attach and VMs to and from Existing Virtual Machine Scale Sets
item.description: You can now easily bring existing VMs to an existing Virtual Machine Scale Set with Flexible Orchestration Mode to take advantage of the scaling orchestrations offered by scale sets. You can now detach a VM from the scale set for isolation and troubleshooting.
item.atom:content: You can now easily bring existing VMs to an existing Virtual Machine Scale Set with Flexible Orchestration Mode to take advantage of the scaling orchestrations offered by scale sets. You can now detach a VM from the scale set for isolation and troubleshooting.

item.title: General Availability of Azure Logic Apps' New Data Mapper for Visual Studio Code
item.description: Data Mapper is Azure Logic Apps' new visual data transformation tool. Now, in general availability, as a Visual Studio Code extension, it can create and edit maps between source and target schemas.
item.atom:content: Data Mapper is Azure Logic Apps' new visual data transformation tool. Now, in general availability, as a Visual Studio Code extension, it can create and edit maps between source and target schemas.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Mv3 Medium Memory (MM) Virtual Machines
item.description: Get improved performance and higher reliability for your memory-optimized workloads with the public preview of the new generation Mv3 Medium Memory (MM) Virtual Machines.
item.atom:content: Get improved performance and higher reliability for your memory-optimized workloads with the public preview of the new generation Mv3 Medium Memory (MM) Virtual Machines.

item.title: Azure Logic Apps Standard VS Code Extension Installation Enhancements in public preview
item.description: Currently, in public preview starting from version 2.80.0, the installation process of the VS Code Extension for Azure Logic Apps Standard will be significantly simplified. The extension will automatically identify and install any required dependencies, such as other extensions or frameworks. This will also encompass all the necessary extensions, including the C# extension essential for debugging.
item.atom:content: Currently, in public preview starting from version 2.80.0, the installation process of the VS Code Extension for Azure Logic Apps Standard will be significantly simplified. The extension will automatically identify and install any required dependencies, such as other extensions or frameworks. This will also encompass all the necessary extensions, including the C# extension essential for debugging.

item.title: General Availability of Application Insights Enhancements for Azure Logic Apps (standard)
item.description: We are also excited to announce the general availability of Application Insights Enhancements for Azure Logic Apps (standard). This new capability gives you a simplified experience for discovering insights about your Logic App workflows and more control over filtering events at the source and reducing your storage costs.
item.atom:content: We are also excited to announce the general availability of Application Insights Enhancements for Azure Logic Apps (standard). This new capability gives you a simplified experience for discovering insights about your Logic App workflows and more control over filtering events at the source and reducing your storage costs.

item.title: Announcing general availability of .NET Framework Custom Code for Azure Logic Apps (standard)
item.description: We are pleased to announce the general availability of .NET Framework Custom Code for Azure Logic Apps (standard). This capability allows customers to extend their low-code solutions with the power of custom code.
item.atom:content: We are pleased to announce the general availability of .NET Framework Custom Code for Azure Logic Apps (standard). This capability allows customers to extend their low-code solutions with the power of custom code.

item.title: Announcing Azure Integration Environment in public preview
item.description: We are excited to introduce a new Azure service that provides unified experience to help customers effectively manage and monitor their integration resources. This service comprises two core components: the Azure Integration Environment and Business Process Tracking, both currently in public preview.
item.atom:content: We are excited to introduce a new Azure service that provides unified experience to help customers effectively manage and monitor their integration resources. This service comprises two core components: the Azure Integration Environment and Business Process Tracking, both currently in public preview.

item.title: Azure Logic Apps workflow assistant in public preview
item.description: Bringing the power of AI to Azure Logic Apps for the first time, this workflow assistant answers any questions you have about Azure Logic Apps from directly within the designer. Currently in public preview, this chat interface provides access to Azure Logic Apps documentation and best practices without requiring you to navigate documentation or search online forums.
item.atom:content: Bringing the power of AI to Azure Logic Apps for the first time, this workflow assistant answers any questions you have about Azure Logic Apps from directly within the designer. Currently in public preview, this chat interface provides access to Azure Logic Apps documentation and best practices without requiring you to navigate documentation or search online forums.

item.category: Azure Database for PostgreSQL; Azure Backup
item.title: Public preview: Azure Backup supports long term retention for backup of Azure Database for PostgreSQL– Flexible Server
item.description: Now you can retain backups for up to 10 years by defining your own backup and retention policy for PostgreSQL- Flexible server.
item.atom:content: Now you can retain backups for up to 10 years by defining your own backup and retention policy for PostgreSQL- Flexible server.

item.title: GA: Ultra Disk performance updates
item.description: Azure Ultra Disk Storage now provides maximum throughput of up to 10 GBps and IOPS of up to 400K IOPS per disk.
item.atom:content: Azure Ultra Disk Storage now provides maximum throughput of up to 10 GBps and IOPS of up to 400K IOPS per disk.

item.title: GA: Stateful entities in Durable Functions on the isolated worker model for .NET
item.description: The stateful entities feature for Durable Functions is now available for .NET apps on the isolated worker model.
item.atom:content: The stateful entities feature for Durable Functions is now available for .NET apps on the isolated worker model.

item.title: Azure Container Storage is now available with Azure Linux container host
item.description: Azure Container Storage (in preview) offers volume management built natively for containers. With the latest update, you can deploy Azure Container Storage on Azure Linux container host.
item.atom:content: Azure Container Storage (in preview) offers volume management built natively for containers. With the latest update, you can deploy Azure Container Storage on Azure Linux container host.

item.title: Azure Functions brings new flexibility with unlimited execution time
item.description: You can now request for access to try out Flex Consumption, a new Azure Functions hosting plan that provides fast scaling and networking features with a serverless billing model.
item.atom:content: You can now request for access to try out Flex Consumption, a new Azure Functions hosting plan that provides fast scaling and networking features with a serverless billing model.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure IoT Operations
item.description: Azure IoT Operations is now in Public Preview. Azure IoT Operations addresses an enterprise’s fundamental needs, but also wrangles edge data to generate local insights and brings interoperability and scalability to IoT solutions.
item.atom:content: Azure IoT Operations is now in Public Preview. Azure IoT Operations addresses an enterprise’s fundamental needs, but also wrangles edge data to generate local insights and brings interoperability and scalability to IoT solutions.

item.title: Generally available: Partitioned namespaces for Azure Service Bus Premium
item.description: Partitoned namespaces for Azure Service Bus, allowing the use of partitioning for the premium messaging tier, is now generally available.
item.atom:content: Partitoned namespaces for Azure Service Bus, allowing the use of partitioning for the premium messaging tier, is now generally available.

item.title: Public preview: Cost analysis add-on for AKS
item.description: You now have increased visibility and transparency into cluster costs.
item.atom:content: You now have increased visibility and transparency into cluster costs.

item.title: Public preview: Vector database add-ons for Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now get started quickly with cognitive search using Azure Container Apps and its native integration with three popular open source vector database variants.
item.atom:content: You can now get started quickly with cognitive search using Azure Container Apps and its native integration with three popular open source vector database variants.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Container Apps adds native support for CNCF Buildpacks to automatically containerize your code
item.description: You can now focus on your code and quickly take your application from source to cloud. There’s no need to understand containers or how to package application code for deployment.
item.atom:content: You can now focus on your code and quickly take your application from source to cloud. There’s no need to understand containers or how to package application code for deployment.
